comments.author: SurfinPanda
comments.body: Looks great! Congrats on launch and hope this takes off.SP

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: wish you luck in this endeavor - though I doubt I will use it. I will have to stick to the forums.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: maybe so - I see it as a means to increase profits (nothing wrong there) and to draw traffic from here to there. Call me sentimental, but I have a soft spot for the forums and prefer to see people build this place up then something else.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: oh for sure - again nothing bad about increasing revenue/profits. I believe I said that originally.no need for the formula - lol I know how it works.  I would just prefer to see the forums built up vs somewhere off the forums being built.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: Eclipse33 on September 06, 2023, 09:30:07 PMQuote from: MoparMiningLLC on September 06, 2023, 09:13:04 PMoh for sure - again nothing bad about increasing revenue/profits. I believe I said that originally.no need for the formula - lol I know how it works.  I would just prefer to see the forums built up vs somewhere off the forums being built. I know you said that originally  I just wanted an excuse to use a formula in a discussion and do some pontification about Austrian economics.  Forum is not going anywhere, but there are not enough people with bitcoins to spend or forum accounts to facilitate a full-scale economy. lol @ the formula.I wish you luck. If the forums are "going nowhere" it might be because people with very little time here such as yourself give up too easy on it either way - I do wish you luck and profits in your endeavor.  Maybe some day my view may change - or yours

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: Love the website...Godspeed on your travels!

comments.author: Frank AlpenCoin
comments.body: Congratulations on the launch of the website.I bought my first collectible on "Coins of Nakamoto". As a newbie, it was easier to buy a Satori Coin there than on bitcointalk. I hope your website finds its place.

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES

comments.body: Congrats! Love it when more options are opened up to the public. Are other people able to sell on your site or are you only selling your personally owned pieces?

As a newbie, it was easier to buy a Satori Coin there than on bitcointalk. [...]I don't think I ever realized you bought a coin from me. Glad to hear that it was a good experience!Quote from: Eclipse33 on September 10, 2023, 11:53:38 PM[...]Coins of Nakamoto is run by a forum member "Mitchell" although I have not seen him here very recently. [...]I am always around. Lurking. Congratulations on the launch of your website Eclipse33!

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: this concept of consignment however is not new and has happened here on the forums for years. Perhaps because you are so new, you did not realize this.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: Eclipse33 on September 11, 2023, 01:51:08 PMQuote from: MoparMiningLLC on September 11, 2023, 01:43:22 PMthis concept of consignment however is not new and has happened here on the forums for years. Perhaps because you are so new, you did not realize this. I have never personally had coins consigned to myself for imaging, listing, grading and advertising purposes. I have acted as an intermediary for reshipping coins to some of my customers. Sorry, I guess I was not very clear.  My point is there are many here that may chime in and offer advice and information as many here have either done consignment for others or have used members such as minerjones to handle their sales.

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.created_time: September 11, 2023, 03:50:28 PMLast edit: September 11, 2023, 04:11:29 PM by CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: Well I'd be interested in giving it a try . I have never submitted my items to a grading company except once. I have seen one other piece graded by a 3rd party but they always seem to get things wrong   . Maybe PCGS can get one correct.  The current engraved pieces remind me of USA territorial minted gold pieces of the 1800's, but will be moving towards high relief portrait pieces that will be similar to titan/norfed quality dies. Sometimes simplicity and straight to the point is all that matters though, like simple territorial pieces. History shows us what territorial gold piece prices can do.  Maybe I will write up a CT encyclopedia and submit my line of product to PCGS and see what happens. If they grade it with no issues, I will contact you on sales in the future. I like to work with others that build people up and not try to tear them down. I feel fairly confident that I'm sitting on the largest physical crypto inventory on the planet (and growing by the month), so I will have supply waiting for the correct moment.

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: Always loved your photos! I'll give PCGS a try.

comments.author: Box Guy
comments.body: Quote from: Eclipse33 on September 27, 2023, 01:22:15 PMI am very happy to announce that we have a scammer stealing our pictures and impersonating us on eBay (again).$3500 Cas coins are a scam for those who are curious. The scam works by getting you off eBay onto telegram. Once on telegram it generally goes downhill from there. This scammer I have dealt with in the past, he is rather convincing.  If you want to lose your fiat and bitcoin, make sure to buy from eclipsepayments1.    The Cas the scammer is claiming to be selling is from a previous auction on the auction platform Scarce City. Oh wow and using your name….. Thanks for the heads up man. You can never be to careful

comments.author: erre
comments.body: Why i have to login to see the coins price?This feels limitating
